content: bulky textured cowl ------------------------------------------------------------------ by tonya sanner berry fun designs i am not one to work with super bulky yarn much but sometimes a quick cozy knit is just what is needed whether a big snowstorm is scheduled to arrive shortly and your teenager has lost the cowl you made them last year or you need a quick gift for a teacher or loved one this textured cowl is a great option for both an enjoyable knit and a beautiful finnished object thiis cowl is created using a single strand of super bulky yarn if you don t have a yarn this bulky in your stash consider holding four strands of worsted or three strands of aran weight together to get the same gauge and look perfect for busting those small amounts you have lingering in your stash thie patteern is simple with knits purls and my version of the knot stitch used throughout if you have a free afternoon or evening you have time to create one of these warm and cozy cowls sizing patteern is available in just one size to fint most everyone if you are not concerned with running out of yarn feel free to add or reduce the stitch count by four to reach your desired size **final measurements of cowl are 5 inches tall by 24 inches in circumference gauge 8 stitches and 12 row over 4 inches in stockinettee stitch yarn needed single strand of super bulky yarn sample uses berry fun yarns super bulky merino 52 yds/120 grams *gauge can also be achieved by holding 3 or 4 strands of worsted/aran together at the same time all content copyright 2025 tonya sanner for personal use only questions comments contact tonya at berryfunyarns@gmail com needles and notions needed us 15 10 mm 16 inch circular needle *one stitch marker to mark beginning of round scissors and tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations used co= cast on k= knit p= purl p2tog = purl two together pattern using the long tail cast on cast on 48 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches ribbing *k1 p1 around for three rounds body of cowl rounds 1 and 2-- knit around round 3 -- *k2 work knot stitch* - repeat stitches between * until end of round knot stitch p2tog leaving the stitches on the left hand needle move working yarn to the back of needle and knit these same two stitches together drop stitches off left hand needle rounds 4 and 5 knit around round 6 -- *work knot stitch k2* - repeat stitches between * until end of round rounds 7 and 8 knit around ribbing *k1 p1 around for three rounds finishing bind off loosely in the k1 p1 patteern wash and lay flaat to
